Thanks <@301186049323958275> and <@340345049063882753> for the explanation, I think I understood the DoS vector, however, the usage that I have in mind is along the lines of 
- Transactions have a timestamp
- Nodes are not allowed to gossip transactions from the future.
- Blocks are not allowed to insert transactions from the future.
The idea is that wallets simply timestamp transactions when they submit them, so by default all gossiping is for transactions from the past. I think this should prevent the DoS vector you mention without hurting UX at all, and it's a cheap deterrent for numerous attacks to forkchoice
